cons: Nothing negative to say about this place

pros: Flex time is the only pro.
cons: Poor management, no accountability, toxic work environment, poor pay. I don’t recommend this employer to anyone.

review_title: Good hospital to work for, but there are things you should know first..............
job_title: Patient Care Technician, PRN in Tyler, TX
pros: Nice coworkers and staff for the most part. Nice facility, good food in cafeteria. Everyone knows everybody. Nice patients for the most part. 90% of the physicians and providers were nice and took time to get to know you as a member of the team regardless of position.
cons:
Nepotism is RAMPANT in this hospital. A lot of managers hiring family, Hospital management has allowed an NP to work in their urgent care who also happened to be the wife of a senior executive in the hospital leadership team. Was denied an opportunity to interview for another internal position due to another employee recommending their family member despite the fact that I was more qualified. 
During the Snow-pocalypse we had, ALL staff at ALL locations (main hospital, and urgent care clinics) were expected to come in regardless of weather or status of utilities in the facility. Granted, this hospital is an OUTPATIENT orthopedic surgery only facility, no one would die if these surgeries were canceled until the weather improved. Their urgent care clinics were very low volume clinics as it is, it was highly doubtful that anyone would come to a minor urgent care while there was several feet of snow on the ground. Staff were told they should be prepared to sleep at hospital facilities for days on end regardless of their situation. (I doubt the one executive told his wife she would have to stay at the urgent care with no electricity or running water). This all occurred while management was able to work from home. (A lot of "do as I say, not as I do" attitude from management. Management did not seem like a team player. I personally raised a question to leadership who were RN's and said "If it comes down to it, and we don't have the staff, you have RN after your name. Are you prepared to roll up your suit sleeves to help out the clinical staff?" I never got an answer)
When I first started in their inpatient unit as a PCT, the unit manager was great and supportive that I was a student. Then she left to go to NP school. The new nurse manager (Deanna Hamilton) came in and that's where things took a turn. I noticed more and more that the unit become more unhappy and at times toxic. Other employees were written up for trivial things. She was not very supportive of me being a student. While people were nice for the most part, I felt very unsupported at times. There would be times were I would ask for help or clarification on policies and the response I would get is "Shouldn't you know that.....did you go to the meetings...…" and other snide comments.

job_title: Human Resources Director in Tyler, TX
pros: Great employees. Great doctors. Employees really care about their patients.

job_title: Family Nurse Practitioner in Longview, TX
Lead Admissions Representative in Tyler, TX
cons: not a lot of room for growth in many departments

review_title: Overall good place to work with few minor issues
pros: People are nice for the most part
cons: Lots of nepotism throughout the company. Family members worked in the same department, etc

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Tyler, TX
pros: Doctors, physical therapy, respiratory therapy, fellow nurse coworkers - everyone works together as a team.  The doctors are easy to talk to and you never have to ask anyone to do their job. Fantastic people to work with. The patient ratio is typically 5:1 and each nurse gets a patient care technician. IT and medical record system offices are easy to get a hold of and will quickly make changes on whatever suggestions you make. Low turn over rate, it took time to get a job at this facility, people don't leave.
cons: Not equipped for acute or emergent situations. It is a small, surgical hospital, no ICU so when things "hit the fan" you are the last stop before the patient transfers out, which is what usually happens. The CPSI medical record system is the worst I have ever used.

review_title: Has been a very satisfying experience due to the positive staff and overall hospital environment
pros: Great medical staff working together to ensure positive patient outcomes
cons: Needs to look at insuring technical staff work load is equivalent.

pros: The pay is amazing as well as the benefits.
cons: Like any work, there is drama, and some employees just can't help but be childish.
